Articles.Content:
I have been practicing surface docking with the claw. I was hoping that getting any part within the confines of the claw would make it happy, but it demands more precision than that (the center of the claw must contact the face of the part to be docked to). So, for some pre-existing airplanes I have, for example, using the claw to dock to the edge of the wing can be problematical (since the height of the wing and the height of the claw have to be pretty close), but grabbing the rear of the jet engine nozzle is much easier... ...although it does look a bit rude.

If you are going to purpose-design surface hardware for this kind of docking, you can include easily accessed vertical plates or beam or truss pieces on the ships to make the docking easier.
Soooooo .... launch escape tower as booster seperatrons? I approve! :)

I like them. A few of my rockets were stacking two of the old SRBs on top of each other, burning in series. This new one simply takes the place of that double-stack. It isn't as violent of a ride, but so far I'm really liking them.

You know, there's a concept called "Throttling Down", which most people seem to ignore.

Or simply just don't want to do. Because moar thrust!

I just found the new version has automatic conic mode switching

Focussed on Kerbin - or on the ship, or on just about anything else - we see the conics drawn in Kerbin's frame of reference (the old mode 3)

https://farm4.staticflickr.com/3747/13586685884_7574507bd4_c.jpg

Focussed on the Mun, we now see the Mun pass in the Mun's frame of reference so we can zoom in and fine-tune our pass. (the old mode 0)

https://farm8.staticflickr.com/7277/13586377943_a59a85d25e_c.jpg

This puts a smile on my face.
Did I mention they have a thrust of 750kN? Woohoo! That's more than almost all the engines except the Mainsail and the new ones.

I love boosted Ion engines! burn for Minmus is 6minutes with 3 enginen craft, burn for duna for 1 engined craft around 20 minutes... Now we talk bussines!

I hear ya, man! An ion lander mission around Minmus was scheduled to be scrubbed due to electricity issues but the new update made it possible again!

i like them but all those booster are small. i got a shuttle that can put 46 tons in orbit and those booster arn't big enough.

I use to clip 3 of kw biggest booster.

because moar booster is better! love there style trough

I'm just loving the improvements to the maneuver node system. Being able to project positions more than 1 orbit ahead is great, but what I've just found make me really happy.

maneuver nodes are now persistent!!! Awesome! You can now quicksave and reload and not loose your nodes, but even more awesome is they remain in place when you switch craft. Not only that, if you switch craft and then target a craft that has nodes setup, you can see its nodes!!

They're also visible in the tracking station (but you can't interact with them there).

That's really awesome, thanks Squad!
They are prety neat. BTW I had to double take on the thread title. First time I read it I got "The Amazing new LIES"
I hadn't thought to use them as sepratrons... They might actually see some use from me in that case.
The new maneuver-node system is awesome. I also noticed, that several clipping issues are gone, f.e. the large battery does not clip anymore... very carefully done.
I prefer the KW one: it doesn't have an attitude motor, but you can add one and configure it.

I don't know if I would use a longer burn time. I've already had to stack lots of extra fuel on the liquid boosters just so the SRB's run out before the liquid ones. If I HAD to have longer burn time, I'd probably just tweak the thrust down and use more of them to give me enough oomph to get up and go.

I'm just saying as having an Ares I type craft, your entire first stage is a SRB. So you don't have to worry about it not running out before anything else.

So, I just went into the tracking station and noticed that I have an asteroid in orbit around Kerbin. I haven't gotten anywhere close to any of the asteroids in my game, let alone do anything to them. Secondly, as I was just about to note how close it got to the Mun, ANOTHER asteroid orbit all of a sudden appeared.

Is this supposed to happen?

EDIT: Nevermind, I just clicked on the orbits, and it turns out that when you click on them, then you can see that it's an escaping trajectory. Weird bug though.

After more reverts than I've had to do in a looong time, finally got a class C in a 150km x2000km orbit. My design took 5 reverts, getting the right orbit took 4, the intercept took 1, but the capture went well at least. Lessons learned: struts are still needed, separatrons are required to kick SLS parts out, make sure KSP is directly under the orbit, and those asteroids are moving fast.
I don't know what the devs did but all of my lag from moving the camera(I'm on a lower end system) is completely gone
same here, i went from around 24 fps to around 60 fps. great job squad!
I can't download
I don't have any stats to show it, but it seems to be running smooth as butter for me

I just want to say 0.23.5 is a thing of beauty. Its really pleasing to see the rockets fly so gracefully now, the junction fix and new parts have given it something of that NASA elegance which is a wonder to behold. Thanks, please keep going!

Love it!

I just landed a class A asteroid near KSC.

The ship was designed only for getting the asteroid into LKO, but I tried to land it just for fun (the craft had 4 parachutes), and I succeeded.

I haven't played in a while, So I'm not sure if I got a Performance boost in the recent update, but if you did, That's good news to hear.

Glad it's working better for ya.
Same for me i have an intel core i3 and a 6670, my FPS has increased massively. I have always said KSP never used my card to render scenes, it seems it does now! Full graphics/AA at 60fps!
I believe the devs have fixed the infamous 'water lag' bug which has plagued KSP players for a while.
